unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: P-value of a 1-sided Test Given t-test
question_text:
A significance test was performed to test ${ H }_{ 0 }:\mu =18$ versus the alternative ${ H }_{ a }:\mu > 18$. Data from a random sample of size $30$ makes a normal distribution and produces a test statistic of $t = 1.734$.
Which of the following intervals contains the P-value for this test?
solution:
Since the alternative hypothesis includes $ > $ we are dealing with $t>1.734$

Below is a picture of the data:

Method 1: Solving by Using the t-distribution Table

In a one sample t-test, the degrees of freedom is $n-1$.
In this case, the degrees of freedom is $30-1=29$.
Using t-distribution table, find $29$ degrees of freedom. Once you have located $29$ D.OF. go across that row and find the two critical values that $1.734$ fall in between.
$1.734$ falls in between $1.699$ and $2.045$.
Go to the top of those respective columns and see what interval of probability is.
The interval of probability is exclusively between $0.025$ and $0.05$.

Method 2: Using the TI graphing calculator

Using the tcdf function(located by hitting 2nd Vars).
$tcdf(1.734,99999, 29)=0.0467$

Below is the calculator input on the TI-84.
